reviews.review_msg: Great professor overall. Fair Midterm and Final, Final Project was carte blanche on any DSP topic and he marked light. Homework was taken from a very good textbook. Lectures were boring and skippable as he's monotone but his slides are quality. Curved the class to an overall B average. Would take again with him.

Can't teach anything to save his life. Feels like he has given up on teaching decades ago and is just cruising until retirement. Lectures are incomprehensibly scattered, and homework is assigned from a book with answers provided. Bad parts are the exams which only have his custom made questions that are impossible even for his own TAs.

He simply lacks the ability to teach material in an understandable way. Lectures are extremely disorganized and not prepared at all. He also comes off as pretty arrogant. For the first month of class, he said the phrase "If you don't know the material then you should drop the class" around 5 times each class. He's just simply not a good professor.

The only time he doesn't sound monotone is when he is laughing at student's questions (which happened) or telling us to drop the course. Handwriting is indecipherable. Solutions to assignments were given and the textbook is good. 4-5 hour "quizzes" every Friday sometimes on topics not yet covered. Barely anything new, just a harder version of 380.

Really terrible lectures, and the textbook is horrible. Quizzes were either unreasonably difficult or easy, no in-between. Assignments didn't properly prepare you for the final exam, with unclear solutions. Overall it was unnecessarily difficult to properly learn the material in this course. This course was a lot of work for very little payoff.

Absolutely brutal final exam. No chance of getting a high score. Quiz and exam content is seemingly pulled from thin air as questions are often completely derived from the machinations of the mind of Daniel Lee. Nearly every single lecture he encouraged to students to "drop the class". He's the only one who teaches this course, so good luck.

Worst prof ever. He doesn't have the attitude problems he used to have, but he is hopelessly disorganized, has incomprehensible notes, goes through easy material way too slowly, etc. Assignments are ridiculously short, but midterm and final were fair. There was very little course material and repeats lots of 380 material. Overall, a waste of time.

He has attitude problem. The class teaching was strictly OK. Seemed cold and distant. Maybe its the result of the degrees from MIT that he does not entertain ideas from students especially undergrads. Avoid if you can...

Hmmm, looks like you guys had a rough time last semester. I agree that he is not very organized, but he is very knowledgeable and has very high interest in the course. His tests were pretty fair and as long as you keep up to his notes you shouldn't do bad in exams. His marking scheme was also pretty fair and to me he seemed like an easy marker.

The only prof I've ever given an "F" to in the evaluation.  Words cannot properly convey the many reasons you should avoid this prof.  He's just... dangerous... when it comes to clear/fair/objective grading schemes (and actually sticking to them)...  Studying for his tests is next to useless, and getting good/bad grades is like rolling dice.
Great lecturer and very easy to talk to. The course was very interesting!
